definitions.definition: The brief terminal part of a vowel or vocal element, differing more or less in quality from the main part.
definitions.example: a as in ale ordinarily ends with a vanish of i as in ill.

definitions.definition: A magic trick in which something seems to disappear.
definitions.example: The French drop is a well-known vanish involving sleight of hand.

definitions.definition: To become invisible or to move out of view unnoticed.

definitions.example: The function f(x)=x^2 vanishes at x=0.
